intro: Oldenlandia mitrasacmoides subsp. nigricans, commonly known as black-flowered mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, elliptic leaves and showy, dark purple to black flowers. The plant typically grows on the branches of trees, drawing water and nutrients from its host. Its floral structure is adapted for pollination by insects, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits. This subspecies is often found in moist, shaded habitats within tropical and subtropical regions.
